title: Facebook Says Users' Passwords Were Visible to Employees
text: The company disclosed a flaw on its social network that made passwords of hundreds of millions of users visible to employees.

title: Zuckerberg's Internet Regulation Plan Is 'Silly,' Open Markets Institute's Hubbard Says
text: Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg has called for new global regulations governing the internet.

title: Facebook restated the obvious in call to regulate: Former FCC chair
text: Michael Powell, former FCC chair, discusses Facebook's call for regulation on CNBC's "Closing Bell."

title: Government regulations will be net positive for Facebook, says market research pro
text: Tony Romm, tech policy reporter with The Washington Post, and Stefanie Miller, senior vice president at Height Capital Markets, break down Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's call for more tech regulation from the government.

title: Facebook CEO Calls For Social Media Regulation
text: Facebook, Inc. co-founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg said in an op-ed published Sunday in read more

title: Facebook has been 'vanguard of criticism' and should address these issues , says AEI's Pethokouis
text: James Pethokoukis, AEI economic policy analyst, and CNBC's Julia Boorstin join 'The Exchange' to discuss Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's call for more regulation in a Washington Post Op-Ed.

title: Investors Shrug As Government Sues Facebook For Housing Discrimination
text: HUD charged Facebook with housing discrimination on March 28. Investors don't seem to care.

title: Kara Swisher on Zuckerberg's call for regulation
text: Recode co-founder Kara Swisher joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss Mark Zuckerberg's op-ed calling for the government to regulate Facebook and others.

title: Here’s what it would take for users to give up Facebook for a month
text: Researchers test how much it would take to give up Facebook for a month as a way to estimate the value of free services to the increasingly digital economy.

title: Zuckerberg lays out his vision for 'high-quality' news in Facebook, hasn't started working on it yet
text: The dedicated news tab sounds similar to Facebook's Watch tab for video.

title: Facebook calls for D.C. to regulate tech
text: Myles Udland, Dan Roberts and Melody Hahm of Yahoo Finance discuss Mark Zuckerberg calling on the government to regulate tech.

title: Facebook CEO Urges for Standard Internet Guidelines
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg urges governments and regulators to play a key role in determining the standard Internet guidelines.

title: Jim Cramer on Why He Liked Mark Zuckerberg's Op-Ed
text: Here's what Jim Cramer liked about Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's op-ed over the weekend.

title: Warren praises Zuckerberg's call for tech regulation after she campaigned for Facebook's breakup
text: Sen. Elizabeth Warren said she is "glad to see" Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg acknowledge the need for tech regulation.

title: Why Facebook is Poised to Beat Earnings Estimates Again
text: Facebook has an impressive earnings surprise history and currently possesses the right combination of the two key ingredients for a likely beat in its next quarterly report.

title: Cramer: Give Zuckerberg credit for embracing internet regulation
text: Facebook founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg published an op-ed in the Washington Post calling for internet regulations in four key areas: harmful content, election integrity, privacy and data portability.

title: Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg calls for internet regulations
text: Fox News senior judicial analyst Judge Andrew Napolitano on Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg calling for stricter Internet regulations.

title: Facebook has a new tool that explains why you're seeing certain posts on your News Feed
text: The new feature shows users the reasoning behind Facebook's ranking of posts from friends, pages and groups on their News Feed.

title: Mark Zuckerberg calls for stronger internet regulation
text: Facebook founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg published an op-ed in the Washington Post calling for internet regulations in four key areas: harmful content, election integrity, privacy and data portability.

title: Zuckerberg says he wants strict European-style privacy laws — but some experts question his motives
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's cry for stricter internet regulation, including widespread adoption of European-style rules, has left some privacy advocates in Europe unimpressed.
